text: hi everyone crush the knee skulltano
here the internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
the new portal album avow
this is the newest lp from blackened
noise death
outfit portal who hail from australia
and are responsible for some of the most
hellish sounds to come out of the metal
underground in the last 10 years
vexivoid swarth utre absolutely
unforgiving albums that
feel like being slowly swallowed into an
interdimensional void
or in the case of the band's previous
record ion
being pumped full of tens of thousands
of volts of electricity
but for some reason it doesn't kill you
so it just kind of goes on
shocking you forever considering how
much of a change aesthetically and
performance wise that record was for
portal i was pretty excited to see what
shape a vowel would take
as portal is nothing if not full of
surprises because they dropped another
record
in tandem with this one hag bulbia is
the title i believe and it features
five noise ambient pieces that
take the band's usual aesthetic mayhem
but distill it down into these
much more abstract boundaryless pieces
and even though many fans are talking
about this record as if it's just a side
piece
there are some genuinely sick moments on
it for example on the track webtoon the
band still delivers a really
hellish tortured sound that is so
brooding and so
immense but without those throttling
guitars and drums then the closing track
hexaduce is even more enveloping in its
bright shimmering distorted
walls of sound there are actually some
relatively prominent guitars and drums
on this track too they're just
kind of set in the back mix-wise and
soaked in reverb it sounds like
i mean whatever it is the band does to
get things to sound
this demonic and this grating and this
cavern is in this evil but then what
about a vow what about this record
to be as straightforward as i possibly
can be
i think for portal this one's a bit of a
dud don't get me wrong by general metal
standards this thing is far
gnarlier and nastier than much of
anything else coming out this year but a
val pales
in comparison to the entirety of the
band's back catalog
in some very apparent ways relatively
speaking this is probably portal's
cleanest
and most direct sounding record to date
as a listener i'm kind of shocked to
find that
these tracks are pretty low effort for
me when it comes to just figuring out
what's going on
making out instrumentally and
compositionally what exactly is
happening and not that an artist must
seek to confuse or aggravate the
audience in order to make a good record
but in the case of portal noise and
atmosphere
and just disorienting audio has been
their namesake for a while now and
if that element is exiting stage right
what is it being replaced by
now in a way i feel like we kind of
already had the answer to that question
with 2018's ion which for portal
was a pretty clean sounding record the
guitars were just like ringing through
with a clarity that was just not really
there on previous records like the
detail and the playing the
embellishments was just so in your face
but what the band did with the extra
space they gave themselves once they
stripped
back a lot of the merc was just place so
freaking insane but on a vow
portal seems so much less encouraged to
fill that space up and i don't know why
uh it's it's there why not fill it
maybe this could be attributed to the
drums and guitars
sounding a bit heavier and beefier this
time around there is certainly more bass
on this
project but in my opinion this chunkier
sound has led to a lot of playing that
is somewhat tame
and again a disappointing lack of sound
play and atmosphere
take for example the pacing of the
guitars and drums on the track bowed
which is just so mind-numbing
comparing this to hair-raising moments
on swarth for example
this track is no scarier than a
community haunted house
now the lengthier moments on this lp do
feature some more creative guitar work
but these tracks also hit pockets where
it feels like they're going nowhere fast
case in point the rising dissonant
chords around the middle of the intro
track which
i love truly one of the most insane and
dissonant moments on the entire lp but
after this the band struggles to do
anything as engaging for the next four
minutes
i will give it here to the curator's
vocals though and on numerous other
tracks from this lp
if anything on this record is really
kind of holding things together
keeping [ __ ] sounding demonic as [ __ ]
it's uh these vocals
man the curator just sounds like a beast
on this lp and
in every portal lp there's just a a
whispery
ghostly throatiness to every howl and
every screen throughout this project
that is
uh blood curdling but for as good as the
vocals are
they're just not enough to make up for
some of the drab backing instrumentation
especially on the drum side why do the
drums sound so flat and lifeless on
numerous tracks here they don't have any
bite or
snap to them there are at least a few
tracks where the kicks and toms sound
less like drums and more like fingers
tapping on the top of a desk
and the audio is getting caught by a
contact mic there are a few other songs
on the track list like i
and awful that start off well enough
maybe even feature some experimental
sound play
but both end up fizzling out in a
somewhat untimely way
if i had to pick a track as a highlight
from this project it may be
manner of speaking as aggressive and as
fast
and as blistering as anything off ion
this is also one of the few moments here
where the bass and guitars
don't just sound heavy but thunderous
and yeah while this track is long and
there's a few
mild passages here and there even those
moments are pretty twisted
the closing track has some ferocious
moments as well
but overall i thought this record was
barely passable for portal a very
mild release for them and i know a lot
of the fans are gonna disagree with this
but
i'm not crazy about this record i don't
like it all that much
but then the ambient noise album they
dropped in tandem with this
i like that one i actually think it's
markedly better than avow
in some ways the hellish noise and sound
play
the band engages in on that lp is
kind of what's missing from a vow the
last
track on the noise record goes
harder than pretty much every song on
a vow but again given that one's not as
much a metal record
i foresee a lot of people disagreeing
with that one still though when it comes
to a vowel
i'm feeling a strong five to a light six
transition have you given this album
a listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
